Keyword.name: fragoutput
Keyword.hint: Fragment output object allow for the creation of \user-defined framebuffers. With them, one can render \to non-Default Framebuffer locations, and thus render \without disturbing the main screen. The fragment \shader is usually used to write to these objects. \ <key>fragoutput</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: image
Keyword.hint: Similar to a texture, but are \accessed by compute commands. \ <key>image</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: instance
Keyword.hint: Instantiate a class from a C# assembly. \ <key>instance</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: pass
Keyword.hint: Define a rendering pass. \ <key>pass</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: sampler
Keyword.hint: Define a sampler state. \ <key>sampler</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: shader
Keyword.hint: Compile a GLSL shader. The shader_type annotation \specifies towards which shader stage this shader \should be compiled. \ <key>shader</key> <param>[name] [shader_type]</param>

Keyword.name: tech
Keyword.hint: Combines render basses into a rendering technique. \ <key>tech</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: text
Keyword.hint: A text object only defines a string \that can be used by other object. \ <key>text</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: texture
Keyword.hint: A texture contains one or more images that all have \the same pixel format. A texture can be used in two \ways. It can be the source of a texture access from \a Shader, or it can be used as a render target. \ <key>texture</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: vertinput
Keyword.hint: Define a vertex input stream that can be used \by a rendering passes to process vertex information. \ <key>vertinput</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: vertoutput
Keyword.hint: Defines a vertex output stream object used to \capture primitives generated by the vertex processing \step(s), recording data from those primitives into \buffer objects. This allows one to preserve the \post-transform rendering state of an object and \resubmit this data multiple times. \ <key>vertoutput</key> <param>[name]</param>

Keyword.name: in
Keyword.hint: Specify a shader input stream from a vertex \buffer object or the previous shader stage.

Keyword.name: out
Keyword.hint: Specify a sshader output stream for the next \shader stage or a transform feedback buffer.

Keyword.name: const
Keyword.hint: Specify a constant variable indicating \that the variable will not change.

Keyword.name: layout
Keyword.hint: Layout qualifiers affect where the storage \for a variable comes from, as well as other \user-facing properties of a particular definition.

Keyword.name: coherent
Keyword.hint: Using this requires the appropriate memory barriers to be \executed, so that visibility can be achieved. When communicating \between shader invocations for different rendering commands, \glMemoryBarrier should be used instead of this qualifier.

Keyword.name: volatile
Keyword.hint: With this qualifier, the compiler assumes that the contents \of the storage represented by the variable could be changed \at any time.

Keyword.name: restrict
Keyword.hint: With this qualifier, you are telling the compiler that this \particular variable is the only variable that can modify the \memory visible through that variable within this shader \invocation (other shader stages do not count here). This \allows the compiler to optimize reads/writes better.

Keyword.name: readonly
Keyword.hint: The variable can only be used for reading operations.

Keyword.name: writeonly
Keyword.hint: The variable can only be used for writing operations \(atomic writes are forbidden because they also count as reads).

Keyword.name: vertices
Keyword.hint: Specify a particular vertex count for \Tessellation Control Shaders output patches.

Keyword.name: points
Keyword.hint: The input/output primitive type of the geometry shader are points.

Keyword.name: lines
Keyword.hint: The input/output primitive type of the geometry shader are lines.

Keyword.name: lines_adjacency
Keyword.hint: The output primitive type of the geometry shader are adjacency lines.

Keyword.name: line_strip
Keyword.hint: The output primitive type of the geometry shader are line strips.

Keyword.name: triangles
Keyword.hint: The input primitive type of the geometry shader are triangles.

Keyword.name: triangles_adjacency
Keyword.hint: The output primitive type of the geometry shader are adjacency triangles.

Keyword.name: triangle_strip
Keyword.hint: The output primitive type of the geometry shader are triangles strips.

Keyword.name: max_vertices
Keyword.hint: The number must be a compile-time constant, and it \defines the maximum number of vertices that will \be written by a single invocation of the GS.

Keyword.name: depth_any
Keyword.hint: Disables the depth test.

Keyword.name: depth_greater
Keyword.hint: To pass the depth test the new depth value must be greater.

Keyword.name: depth_less
Keyword.hint: To pass the depth test the new depth value must be less.

Keyword.name: depth_unchanged
Keyword.hint: To pass the depth test the new depth value must be equal.

Keyword.name: early_fragment_tests
Keyword.hint: Perform depth test before executing the shader.

Keyword.name: origin_upper_left
Keyword.hint: Specifies that gl_FragCoord will have the origin \(0, 0) in the upper-left of the screen.

Keyword.name: pixel_center_integer
Keyword.hint: Specifies that the X and Y of gl_FragCoord \will be shifted by a half-pixel, so that the \center of each pixel is an integer value.

Keyword.name: index
Keyword.hint: Used in combination with the location \qualifier for dual source blending.

Keyword.name: location
Keyword.hint: Assigns the stream to the specified unit.

Keyword.name: component
Keyword.hint: Used in combination with the location \qualifier to address specific vec- \components of the input/output stream.

Keyword.name: xfb_buffer
Keyword.hint: Specifies the transform feedback output buffer.
